items.name: Ext.grid.plugin.DragDrop
allowCopy
items.text: Set as `true` to allow the user to hold down the control key at the start of the drag operation and copy the dragged records between grids. Otherwise, dragged records will be moved. **Note:** This only applies to records dragged between two different grids with unique stores. See copy to enable the copying of all dragged records.

items.name: containerScroll
items.text: `true` to register this container with the Scrollmanager for auto scrolling during drag operations. A Ext.dd.ScrollManager configuration may also be passed.

items.name: copy
items.text: Set as `true` to copy the records from the source grid to the destination drop grid. Otherwise, dragged records will be moved. **Note:** This only applies to records dragged between two different grids with unique stores. See allowCopy to allow only control-drag operations to copy records.

items.name: ddGroup
items.text:
A named drag drop group to which this object belongs. If a group is specified, then both the DragZones and
DropZone used by this plugin will only interact with other drag drop objects in the same group.

items.name: dragGroup
items.text: The ddGroup to which the DragZone will belong. This defines which other DropZones the DragZone will interact with. Drag/DropZones only interact with other Drag/DropZones which are members of the same ddGroup.

items.name: dragText
items.text:
The text to show while dragging.

Two placeholders can be used in the text:

- `{0}` The number of selected items.
- `{1}` 's' when more than 1 items (only useful for English).

items.name: dragZone
items.text: A config object to apply to the creation of the property-dragZone which handles for drag start gestures. Template methods of the DragZone may be overridden using this config.

items.name: dropGroup
items.text: The ddGroup to which the DropZone will belong. This defines which other DragZones the DropZone will interact with. Drag/DropZones only interact with other Drag/DropZones which are members of the same ddGroup.

items.name: dropZone
items.text: A config object to apply to the creation of the property-dropZone which handles mouseover and drop gestures. Template methods of the DropZone may be overridden using this config.

items.name: enableDrag
items.text: `false` to disallow dragging items from the View.

items.name: enableDrop
items.text: `false` to disallow the View from accepting drop gestures.

items.name: pluginId
stateEvents
items.text: The configured list of stateEvents used to (optionally) participate in Owner Component's state management.

items.name: beforedrop
node
items.text: The Ext.grid.View node **if any** over which the cursor was positioned.

items.name: data
items.text: The data object gathered at mousedown time by the cooperating Ext.dd.DragZones Ext.dd.DragZone#getDragData method. It contains the following properties:

items.name: copy
items.text: The value of copy. Or `true` if allowCopy is true **and** the control key was pressed as the drag operation began.

items.name: view
items.text:
The source grid view from which the drag
originated

items.name: ddel
items.text: The drag proxy element which moves with the cursor

items.name: item
items.text:
The grid view node upon which the mousedown event
was registered

items.name: records
items.text:
An Array of Models representing the
selected data being dragged from the source grid view

items.name: overModel
items.text: The Model over which the drop gesture took place

items.name: dropPosition
items.text:
`"before"` or `"after"` depending on whether the
cursor is above or below the mid-line of the node.

items.name: dropHandlers
items.text:
This parameter allows the developer to control when the drop action takes place.
It is useful if any asynchronous processing needs to be completed before
performing the drop. This object has the following properties:

items.name: wait
items.text:
Indicates whether the drop should be deferred.
Set this property to true to defer the drop.

items.name: processDrop
items.text:
A function to be called to complete
the drop operation.

items.name: cancelDrop
items.text:
A function to be called to cancel the
drop operation.

items.name: drop
items.text: **This event is fired through the Ext.grid.View and its owning Ext.grid.Panel. You can add listeners to the grid or grid Ext.grid.Panel#viewConfig object** Fired when a drop operation has been completed and the data has been moved or copied.

items.name: node
items.text: The Ext.grid.View node **if any** over which the cursor was positioned.

items.name: data
items.text: The data object gathered at mousedown time by the cooperating Ext.dd.DragZones Ext.dd.DragZone#getDragData method. It contains the following properties:

items.name: copy
items.text: The value of copy. Or `true` if allowCopy is true **and** the control key was pressed as the drag operation began.

items.name: view
items.text:
The source grid view from which the drag
originated

items.name: ddel
items.text: The drag proxy element which moves with the cursor

items.name: item
items.text:
The grid view node upon which the mousedown event
was registered

items.name: records
items.text:
An Array of Models representing the
selected data being dragged from the source grid view

items.name: overModel
items.text:
The Model over which the drop gesture took
place.

items.name: dropPosition
items.text:
`"before"` or `"after"` depending on whether the
cursor is above or below the mid-line of the node.

items.name: applyState
items.text:
The applyState method is invoked by the client Component's State mixin after initComponent method has been run for the client.

The supplied implementation is empty. If plugin Subclasses are to (optionally) participate in the client Component's
state management, implementers should provide a suitable method to utilize it.

items.name: state
items.text: The current plugin state object to be applied.

items.name: allState
items.text: The current aggregate state of the Component and all plugins.

items.name: clonePlugin
items.text: Creates clone of the plugin.

items.name: overrideCfg
items.text: Additional config for the derived plugin.

items.name: constructor
items.text: Instantiates the plugin.

items.name: config
items.text: Configuration object.

items.name: destroy
items.text: Component calls destroy on all its plugins at destroy time.

items.name: disable
items.text:
The base implementation just sets the plugin's `disabled` flag to `true`

Plugin subclasses which need more complex processing may implement an overriding implementation.

items.name: enable
items.text:
The base implementation just sets the plugin's `disabled` flag to `false`

Plugin subclasses which need more complex processing may implement an overriding implementation.

items.name: getCmp
items.text: Returns the component to which this plugin is attached.
Owner component.

items.name: getState
items.text: The getState method is invoked by the client Component's State mixin when one or more of the the specified stateEvents are raised. The supplied implementation is empty. If plugin Subclasses are to (optionally) participate in the client Component's state management, implementers should provide a suitable method which returns a state object.
state

items.name: init
items.text:
The init method is invoked after initComponent method has been run for the client Component.

The supplied implementation is empty. Subclasses should perform plugin initialization, and set up bidirectional
links between the plugin and its client Component in their own implementation of this method.

items.name: client
items.text: The client Component which owns this plugin.

items.name: setCmp
items.text: Sets the component to which this plugin is attached.

items.name: cmp
items.text: Owner component.

items.name: dragZone
items.text: An Ext.view.DragZone which handles mousedown and dragging of records from the grid.

items.name: dropZone
items.text: An Ext.grid.ViewDropZone which handles mouseover and dropping records in any grid which shares the same dropGroup.

items.name: isPlugin
items.text: `true` in this class to identify an object as an instantiated Plugin, or subclass thereof.
